Name: James McLean
Address: R.R.1, Shaunavon
Birthplace: Douglas, Lanark, Scotland

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS
   What year did you start homesteading in eastern Canada? 1923
   Where did you settle homesteading? Shaunavon, Saskatchewan
   Where had you been living before that? Scotland
   For how many people did you prepare meals? 6
   How far was it to your nearest store? 25 miles
   How often could a visit be made to the store? when we could
   What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS
   What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Willard's
   In what quantities did you buy it? 10 lb. bag
   What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $3.75
   How much did you use Graham flour?
   Whole wheat flour?
   Was flour milled locally? Yes
   How far away? 40 miles
   What year? 1926
   What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? 75 cents
   What other grain products did you use? Cornmeal
   Whole wheat? Purina?
   Other?

   How did you grind it? Electric mill

16. WRAPPINGS AND CONTAINERS

Mention any changes which you recall in the wrappings and containers received with the food you purchased (give dates where possible).

At the store goods were weighted. I used paper bags gradually they began to come weighed & wrapped from the wholesale.

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

Porridge Potatoes Bread Butter Jam.
1904 to 96 Parents, 2 girls, 2 boys.
Adults 6 in 1904.

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in Eastern Canada? Give the menu. List those present and give their approximate ages at that time.

Christmas dinners in the early years were the same as the usual ones.

19. Were you ever reduced to almost starvation level living on one or two locally produced foods? Give details.

No, hardly.

Self grown. Baking lots of bread.
15. What was your favorite food at Christmas? (Give details here.)

At the first growth years we would have fried potatoes, gravy, and ham.

16. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner, etc.) for the earliest years you can remember. Give the date, time, and location of the family gathering or event.

Breakfast: Fried potatoes, gravy, ham.

Dinner: Turkey, mashed potatoes, cranberry sauce, green beans, cornbread.

17. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in eastern Canada?

18. Give the menu. List dishes present and give their approximate cost at that time.

Christmas dinner in the early years was the same as the usual one.

19. Were you ever reduced to almost starvation level by locally purchased foods? Give details.

Yes, rarely.
20. Mention any outstanding differences in the preparation of meals in the earliest days as compared with today.

For More Variety, More Convenience
Much Better Equipment.

21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of homestead and home prepared foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible).

Not yet.
